title: Line Flow - Return for Credit with Receipt Activities

textBeforeTable: For more information about individual function activities, refer to Seeded Function Activity Definitions. The following table provides descriptions of each function activity in Change Order Process. Change Order Process Activities The properties of the CTO Change Order process indicate that it is runnable, it can be called by other processes. Summary of the Change Order Process The Change Order Process is contained in the seeded data file CTO Change Order and is associated with the CTO Change Order item type. For more information on the CTO Change Order process, please refer to the Oracle Configure to Order Process Guide. Note: Note: Please note that notifications for drop shipments are not sent using this process. For multi level, or multi organization configurations and ATO items a notification of the changes is always sent, regardless of whether a reservation exists for the top level configuration or ATO Item. For single-level, single-organization configurations and ATO items a notification is sent only if a reservation or flow schedule exists for the configuration. If there are configuration changes, a notification is sent even if no reservation exists. This process sends a notification about the change(s) to different people depending on which item has been modified: If configured and ATO items are changed, a notification is sent to the planner of the top model/item in the shipping organization. For Purchase to Order ATO items, a notification is sent to the buyer on the requisition. Only one message is
textAfterTable: Change Order Process If you change any order details (other than CTO/ATO/PTO items) on the Sales Orders window, you can send a notification to other users with the details of the change. Actions > Notification in the Sales Orders window enables you to initiate the OM Change Order process. This process can also be initiated in an error message by selecting the Notify option. Change Order Process is contained in the Seeded Data File oexwford.wft and is associated with the OM Change Order item type. Summary of the Change Order Process The OM Change Order process properties indicate that it is runnable, it can be assigned to other processes. Sending a notification using the Sales Orders window The following process diagram displays OM Change Order. As in CTO Change Order, the Change Order Notification activity is a seeded function. Change Order Workflow Change Order Process Activities The following table provides descriptions of each activity in Change Order Process.
